Computational Linguistics: The interdisciplinary field modeling natural language from a computational perspective, including NLP.
Phonetics & Phonology: The study of the sounds of human speech (phonetics) and their systematic organization in language (phonology).
Psycholinguistics: The study of the psychological and neurobiological factors enabling humans to acquire, use, and understand language.
Semantics & Pragmatics: The study of meaning in language, both in its literal sense (semantics) and its contextual, inferred sense (pragmatics).
Syntax: The study of the rules and principles that govern the sentence structure of languages.
